name: Best Gluten-Free Pita Bread
author: Fioa
summary: Bake this perfect gluten-free pita bread from scratch with a few simple ingredients. A wonderful gluten-free alternative for sandwiches and snacks.
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups gluten-free oat flour (such as Bob's Red Mill®)
directions: Combine oat flour, potato starch, cornstarch, tapioca flour, xanthan gum, yeast, sugar, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer; whisk until well mixed, about 1 minute
Whisk milk, egg, olive oil, and vinegar together in a separate bowl until well combined, about 1 minute
Stir milk mixture in gradually to the flour mixture on low speed; mix until a soft dough comes together, about 5 minutes
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper
Divide dough into 6 equal pieces; roll each piece on a floured surface to a 6-inch circle
Place on the prepared baking sheets; cover with plastic wrap and set aside for 1 to 1 1/2 hours
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Heat a pizza stone in the oven
Spray pita breads with water and place them straight on the hot pizza stone
Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and lightly golden, 5 to 7 minutes
